      • setMask

        public void setMask(java.lang.String xmlMask)
        Set the mask in XML form.

        Valid types are DIGIT, ALPHA_NUM, ANY, LETTER and LETTER_OR_DIGIT.

        Valid type modifiers are lowercase and uppercase.

        The attribute fixed-length sets a fixed length, thus padding the segment. The attributes pad-char and pad-side set the padding parameters. Not setting them uses a space pad character and a left pad side.

        The attribute maximum-length sets a variable length segment with the maximum number of characters. The attributes in the above paragraph can not be set.

        Not setting either fixed-length or maximum-length means that the segment is variable length and has no limit.

        The attribute exclude is used to indicate a list of characters to exclude. Special xml characters must be escaped.

        The unique attribute text sets a fixed text mask.

        Example:

        <!-- 2 letters uppercase. -->
        <mask type="LETTER" fixed-length="2" uppercase/>
        <!-- A fixed text of 2 hyphens. -->
        <mask text="--"/>
        <!-- 10 characters, letter or digit, uppercase, including dots and hiphens. -->
        <mask type="LETTER_OR_DIGIT" fixed-length="10" uppercase include=".-"/>
        <!-- A fixed text of 2 hyphens. -->
        <mask text="--"/>
        <!-- Alphanumeric, 5 characters maximum, not fixed, no modifier. -->
        <mask type="ALPHA_NUM" maximum-length="5"/>

        Parameters:
        xmlMask - The mask.
